intro: Graellsia, commonly known as the orchid butterfly or the orchid hawkmoth, is a genus of moths in the family Sphingidae. These insects are characterized by their large, robust bodies and long, slender wings that often display striking patterns and colors. Graellsia species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, where they play a role in pollination. Their larvae feed on various plants, including those in the legume family. The genus is named in honor of the Spanish botanist José Antonio Graells.
